value.title: New Contoso Sample app for Power BI Embedded

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: Personal Gateway governance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gateway sprawl in Power BI can be a problem for organizations looking to govern what data can be refreshed. Learn how you can govern the Personal Gateway to keep it under control. value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?

Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names! value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory

value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited

value.title: Setup a Reverse Hybrid Table without using Tabular Editor for Power BI!
value.excerpt: Hybrid Tables can be very useful for mixing archived data with current data. Pat Mahoney joins Patrick to show how to configure a Hybrid Table within a Power BI dataset without using Tabular Editor. Just some straight "M"agic.  Hybrid Table Documentation: https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/service-dataset-modes-understand#hybrid-tables
